questions.question_text_1: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : OPERATING SYSTEM (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)
question_texts: THIS IS QUESTION PAPER FOR THE SUBJECT "DEGREE LEVEL : OPERATING SYSTEM (COMPUTER BASED EXAM)"  ARE YOU SURE YOU HAVE TO WRITE EXAM FOR THIS SUBJECT? CROSS CHECK YOUR HALL TICKET TO CONFIRM THE SUBJECTS TO BE WRITTEN.  (IF IT IS NOT THE CORRECT SUBJECT, PLS CHECK THE SECTION AT THE TOP FOR THE SUBJECTS REGISTERED BY YOU)

questions.question_text_1: State True or False  In RISC-V, during system calls, the mstatus register stores the current mode of operation of the processor.
question_texts: State True or False  In RISC-V, during system calls, the mstatus register stores the current mode of operation of the processor.

questions.question_text_1: The ecall instruction in the xv6 operating system facilitates the transition of the CPU from user mode to supervisor mode.
question_texts: The ecall instruction in the xv6 operating system facilitates the transition of the CPU from user mode to supervisor mode.

questions.question_text_1: What is a race condition in an operating system?
question_texts: What is a race condition in an operating system?

options.option_text: Concurrent access leading to unpredictable results
System instability due to competing tasks.

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary purpose of the kvminit function in the xv6 operating system?
question_texts: What is the primary purpose of the kvminit function in the xv6 operating system?

questions.question_text_1: State True or False.  The init process, being the first process created by the system, can exit using the exit system call.
question_texts: State True or False.  The init process, being the first process created by the system, can exit using the exit system call.

questions.question_text_1: In the context of xv6 operating systems, what does the zombie state of a process refer to?
question_texts: In the context of xv6 operating systems, what does the zombie state of a process refer to?

options.option_text: A process that has terminated, but whose resources have not yet beendeallocated by the operating system.
A process that is suspended and waiting for user input.
A process that is ready to run but is waiting for CPU time.

questions.question_text_1: In the xv6 operating system, if a timer interrupt occurs while a process is executing, what will be the state transition of the process?
question_texts: In the xv6 operating system, if a timer interrupt occurs while a process is executing, what will be the state transition of the process?

options.option_text: The number of CPUs supported by xv6 is 64.
The size of each struct proc is 64 bytes.
The array proc can dynamically resize to handle more than 64 processes.
The system can handle a maximum of 64 processes simultaneously.

questions.question_text_1: If the memory map for a device starts from the offset 0x30004000 and has a size of 512 bytes in a 32-bit addressing scheme, what will be the last address in the memory map?
question_texts: If the memory map for a device starts from the offset 0x30004000 and has a size of 512 bytes in a 32-bit addressing scheme, what will be the last address in the memory map?

options.option_text: Sizes of all the registers are 4-byte.
Sizes of control register, data register, and status register are 2-byte, 4-byte,and 1-byte respectively.
Sizes of control register, data register, and status register are 2-byte, 4-byte,and 2-byte respectively.
Sizes of control register, data register, and status register are 16-byte, 32-byte,and 8-byte respectively.
Both the parent and child processes execute the pwd command concurrently.
The parent process waits for the child process to finish executing the pwdcommand.
The parent process executes the pwd command and then waits for the childprocess to finish.

questions.question_text_1: What is the correct sequence of setting up first user process?  (i) Find an unused proc entry. (ii) Create trapframe. (iii) Create empty user process page table. (iv) Create context for process.
question_texts: What is the correct sequence of setting up first user process?  (i) Find an unused proc entry. (ii) Create trapframe. (iii) Create empty user process page table. (iv) Create context for process.

questions.question_text_1: Consider a process P1 that forks P2, P2 forks P3, and P3 forks P4. P1 and P2 continue to execute while P3 terminates. Now, what is the parent process of P4?
question_texts: Consider a process P1 that forks P2, P2 forks P3, and P3 forks P4. P1 and P2 continue to execute while P3 terminates. Now, what is the parent process of P4?

options.option_text: The return address of the user space
The number that is returned to the user space.
The number that identifies the system call.
The number that identifies the process

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following actions are performed by userinit?
question_texts: Which of the following actions are performed by userinit?

options.option_text: It sets the process to a sleeping state.
It allocates a process id and trapframe.
It creates a user stack at 0X0.

questions.question_text_1: Assume Process P2 and Process P4 are waiting for an input, Process P1 is running, and Process P3 was running before Process P1 and is now waiting for its turn to run. Select all the correct statements about the states of the processes.
question_texts: Assume Process P2 and Process P4 are waiting for an input, Process P1 is running, and Process P3 was running before Process P1 and is now waiting for its turn to run. Select all the correct statements about the states of the processes.

options.option_text: Process P2 is in the RUNNABLE state
Process P4 is in the SLEEPING state.
Process P1 is in the RUNNING state.
Process P3 is in the SLEEPING state.
Process P3 is in the RUNNABLE state.

questions.question_text_1: Consider a system with a virtual memory space size of 8 GB and a single page table with 218 entries. What is the size of each page frame?
question_texts: Consider a system with a virtual memory space size of 8 GB and a single page table with 218 entries. What is the size of each page frame?

questions.question_text_1: Consider a system with 64 MB of physical memory and a 32-bit virtual address space. Given a page size of 4 KB, what will be the number of frames?
question_texts: Consider a system with 64 MB of physical memory and a 32-bit virtual address space. Given a page size of 4 KB, what will be the number of frames?
